dialogueTree.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "A police badge on which you see the..."
dialogueTree.text: A police badge on which you see the photo of a man -- you. Some seaweed is stuck to the back.

links.title: You: "Look at the photo."
links.text: Look at the photo.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "The man keeps winking at you with h..."
links.text: The man keeps winking at you with his green-grey eyes. The photo is old, no doubt about that.

links.title: Logic: "But the badge is new. You used an o..."
links.text: But the badge is new. You used an old photo for a new badge.

links.title: Suggestion: "Good choice. A newer photo would lo..."
links.text: Good choice. A newer photo would look... different.

links.title: You: "How old?"
links.text: How old?

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "Eight, maybe ten years. The guy in..."
links.text: Eight, maybe ten years. The guy in the picture is rather good looking. He's got a nice haircut and is distinctly lacking in massive sideburns.

links.title: You: "And he's winking? Why?"
links.text: And he's winking? Why?

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "Why do you think? His face is alrea..."
links.text: Why do you think? His face is already contorted by the Expression. Although it looks less grotesque on him than it does on you now.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It looks better on him because he i..."
links.text: It looks better on him because he isn't in as much *pain* while producing it as you are now. Although there's already a hint of that pain, certainly.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Don't be fooled. The bad times have..."
links.text: Don't be fooled. The bad times have already begun.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Wake up the past and tell it to sta..."
links.text: Wake up the past and tell it to stay awake -- the bad times are here to stay.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "It looks like you had quite the cha..."
links.text: It looks like you had quite the charming face -- way back then. Your hair is brown and slightly curly, your eyes seem more clear somehow.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The lack of alcohol swelling is a b..."
links.text: The lack of alcohol swelling is a bonus. Though there's a *pinch* of that in your cheeks already.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Don't be fooled. The bad times have..."
links.text: Don't be fooled. The bad times have already begun.

links.title: You: ""Name: Harrier Du Bois...""
links.text: "Name: Harrier Du Bois..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""'Harrier,' that's long for 'Harry'..."
links.text: "'Harrier,' that's long for 'Harry'. So you *are* Harry..." He thinks. "Evrart was half right. Probably not a lot of people know your full name. Whoever told him you're Harry Du Bois didn't."

links.title: You: ""Strange. It doesn't say Raphaël Am..."
links.text: "Strange. It doesn't say Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not strange at all -- your name is..."
links.text: "Not strange at all -- your name is Harrier Du Bois. Like it says on your police badge."

links.title: You: ""Wait, what kind of name is 'Harrie..."
links.text: "Wait, what kind of name is 'Harrier'?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a wartime name. Revolutionary..."
links.text: "It's a wartime name. Revolutionary. The kind mothers give their sons during troubled times. Like 'Undying' or 'Boxer' or 'Ironhide'."

links.title: Endurance: "It's meant to keep you safe."
links.text: It's meant to keep you safe.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "...from bullets, hunger, shrapnel,..."
links.text: ...from bullets, hunger, shrapnel, kidnappings, and worse.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A name like armour."
links.text: A name like armour.

links.title: You: ""But... I don't *want* to be Harrie..."
links.text: "But... I don't *want* to be Harrier Du Bois." (Don't accept it.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why? It's a cool name. I like it."..."
links.text: "Why? It's a cool name. I like it." He shrugs. "Besides, you're Harry anyway. No one's ever called *Harrier*."

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "The badge in your hands shines as y..."
links.text: The badge in your hands shines as you rotate it, catching light. You see lines of information:

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He's not going to call you Harrier...."
links.text: He's not going to call you Harrier. He'll keep calling you 'officer' when he's angry with you and 'detective' when he's not.

links.title: You: ""Harrier Du Bois it is, then." (Acc..."
links.text: "Harrier Du Bois it is, then." (Accept it.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Pleased to make your acquaintance,..."
links.text: "Pleased to make your acquaintance, Harrier Du Bois."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Harrier Du Bois..." He looks you u..."
links.text: "Harrier Du Bois..." He looks you up and down. "It suits you. I'm going to call you 'Harry,' since it's short for 'Harrier'."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "No, he's not. He's going keep calli..."
links.text: No, he's not. He's going keep calling you "officer" when he's angry with you -- and "detective" when he's not.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "This document confirms it -- Harrie..."
links.text: This document confirms it -- Harrier Du Bois, i.e. Harry, is really your name.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "This is your name. You are Harrier..."
links.text: This is your name. You are Harrier Du Bois. Harry.

links.title: You: ""Rank: LTN-2JFR?""
links.text: "Rank: LTN-2JFR?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Lieutenant double-yefreitor.""
links.text: "Lieutenant double-yefreitor."

links.title: You: ""What is a 'lieutenant double-yefre..."
links.text: "What is a 'lieutenant double-yefreitor?'"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The lieutenant is a rank above ser..."
links.text: "The lieutenant is a rank above sergeant and below captain. It's the highest rank in the RCM that still does field work. I am a lieutenant."

links.title: You: ""And double-yefreitor?""
links.text: "And double-yefreitor?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The title of yefreitor is added to..."
links.text: "The title of yefreitor is added to your rank when you decline a promotion to a higher rank -- in your case, captain," the lieutenant explains. "You have declined twice. Thus you're double-yefreitor."

links.title: You: ""Declined?""
links.text: "Declined?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There are many reasons one would d..."
links.text: "There are many reasons one would do this. The rank above you in your precinct's *décomptage* might be taken. Or sometimes promoted officers do not *want* to replace their superiors -- out of respect."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And sometimes," he continues, "the..."
links.text: "And sometimes," he continues, "they just prefer the type of police work available to their current rank -- in your case, lieutenant."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Heavy-duty case-solving machine."
links.text: Heavy-duty case-solving machine.

links.title: You: ""What's a 'décomptage'?""
links.text: "What's a 'décomptage'?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Décomptage is the hierarchical sys..."
links.text: "Décomptage is the hierarchical system employed by the Revachol Citizens Militia. It means counting down to twos."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The countdown is modelled after the..."
links.text: The countdown is modelled after the dual-leadership system employed by the Left during the Revolution. Which in turn was developed by last century experimental psychologists in the University of Koenigstein.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The lowest rank is junior officer..."
links.text: "The lowest rank is junior officer -- usually teenagers. Then there are the patrol officers. Then sergeants, lieutenants, and then a captain. That's basically it, except for a few kinks."

links.title: You: ""What kinks?""
links.text: "What kinks?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Kinks like satellite-officers and..."
links.text: "Kinks like satellite-officers and the additional yefreitor rank I already explained."

links.title: Authority: "The long and short of it is: you're..."
links.text: The long and short of it is: you're his superior.

links.title: You: ""Wait -- satellite-officers?""
links.text: "Wait -- satellite-officers?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You are given the title of 'satell..."
links.text: "You are given the title of 'satellite-officer' if your partner is quickly promoted through the ranks and you rise with him. You don't seem to be a satellite..."

links.title: You: ""So you've been putting up with all..."
links.text: "So you've been putting up with all my bullshit because I'm your superior?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not putting up with anything,"..."
links.text: "I'm not putting up with anything," the lieutenant says with a little smile. "You put your life on the line and we came out on top. That matters."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""More than driving your motor carri..."
links.text: "More than driving your motor carriage into the sea. The upside of that is, of course, you finding your badge."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. I've been putting up with you..."
links.text: "No. I've been putting up with you because, despite an unconventional approach, you're doing good police work."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It matters more than driving your..."
links.text: "It matters more than driving your motor carriage into the sea." He smiles encouragingly. "And now we've even found your badge."

links.title: Empathy: "He trusts you -- for now. Try not t..."
links.text: He trusts you -- for now. Try not to spoil it.

links.title: Empathy: "Still -- he doesn't trust you compl..."
links.text: Still -- he doesn't trust you completely.

links.title: You: ""So you've been putting up with me..."
links.text: "So you've been putting up with me because we're of the same rank?"

links.title: You: ""Thanks for explaining all this." (..."
links.text: "Thanks for explaining all this." (Don't mention it.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My pleasure.""
links.text: "My pleasure."

links.title: You: ""I thought my rank was *drunk*.""
links.text: "I thought my rank was *drunk*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, apparently you've had a rathe..."
links.text: "Yes, apparently you've had a rather successful career in the past and," -- he pauses to examine you -- "this leads me to believe maybe your current *situation* is only temporary."

links.title: You: ""I won't forsake the drink -- it ma..."
links.text: "I won't forsake the drink -- it makes me happy."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It does seem to be a rather *speci..."
links.text: "It does seem to be a rather *special* relationship the two of you have forged, yes, lieutenant double-yefreitor."

links.title: You: ""Thanks. That gives me hope.""
links.text: "Thanks. That gives me hope."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good," he says with a quick smile."
links.text: "Good," he says with a quick smile.

links.title: You: ""I'm afraid there are no ex-alcohol..."
links.text: "I'm afraid there are no ex-alcoholics."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""People have been through worse and..."
links.text: "People have been through worse and gotten back on their feet, lieutenant double-yefreitor," he says with a reassuring little smile.

links.title: You: ""I don't want to get better -- I wa..."
links.text: "I don't want to get better -- I want to get worse."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I... uh, don't really know how to..."
links.text: "I... uh, don't really know how to respond to that, lieutenant double-yefreitor."

links.title: You: "Turn back to the document."
links.text: Turn back to the document.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "Such a small yet precious thing. Ex..."
links.text: Such a small yet precious thing. Expensive paper caught between thick plastic like a fly in amber. It reads:

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "That's what it says on the badge. N..."
links.text: That's what it says on the badge. No more information is provided.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You should look at the badge when L..."
links.text: You should look at the badge when Lieutenant Kitsuragi is around -- he could help you make sense of all this.

links.title: You: ""Serial: REV12-62-05-JAM41...""
links.text: "Serial: REV12-62-05-JAM41..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's just the serial number. Rev..."
links.text: "That's just the serial number. Revachol, Jamrock, Precinct 41, with some numbers thrown in there for good measure."

links.title: Logic: "The numbers are not there for 'good..."
links.text: The numbers are not there for 'good measure'. They have an administrative purpose. One that's unfortunately been erased from your memory.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "Revachol, Jamrock, Precinct 41. You..."
links.text: Revachol, Jamrock, Precinct 41. You don't remember what the numbers in the middle mean.

links.title: You: ""Date of issue: 7th of November, '5..."
links.text: "Date of issue: 7th of November, '50..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Four months ago -- I'm guessing th..."
links.text: "Four months ago -- I'm guessing that's when you were promoted to the rank of lieutenant double-yefreitor."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A new badge usually comes with a n..."
links.text: "A new badge usually comes with a new rank. You seem to have been... doing well then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Four months ago? Seems like a new..."
links.text: "Four months ago? Seems like a new document was recently made. One is handed to you as part of a promotion, or... if you lose the old one.

links.title: Endurance: "The pain in your chest tells you yo..."
links.text: The pain in your chest tells you you were working yourself to death to earn that rank.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "The case created a lot of *edge* yo..."
links.text: The case created a lot of *edge* you have to *take off*. The death march really gets us going.

links.title: Logic: "You're pretty sure you weren't doin..."
links.text: You're pretty sure you weren't doing *well* -- but better? Probably yes.

links.title: Inland Empire: "A lot can happen in four months. Es..."
links.text: A lot can happen in four months. Especially in winter. The winters are never easy on you, of that you are sure.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "I remember that time... the tie aro..."
links.text: I remember that time... the tie around your neck feels tight suddenly. That was a good time. We had a good work/drink balance going. What happened, man? Pump it up.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "The badge was issued roughly four m..."
links.text: The badge was issued roughly four months ago.

links.title: Logic: "A new document is given to you as p..."
links.text: A new document is given to you as part of a promotion. Or when you lose the old one.

links.title: You: ""Precinct: 41?""
links.text: "Precinct: 41?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. It's the designation of your..."
links.text: "Yes. It's the designation of your Precinct. Forty-one. Like mine says Fifty-seven. The 57th is mostly Industrial Harbour. A lot of asphalt. The 41st is..." He stops.

links.title: You: ""What?"
links.text: "What?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a *tough* station to work in...."
links.text: "It's a *tough* station to work in. You have all of Jamrock to cover -- that district should have *three* precincts, but money is what it is."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's no wonder you are like you are..."
links.text: It's no wonder you are like you are, he thinks. But then again...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But then again..." A faint smile...."
links.text: "But then again..." A faint smile. "It's a legendary district. And a hell of a station too. It must be an honour and a curse to work with people like Pryce, McCoy, Berdyayeva..."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "...Roberts, Feuerbach, De Mettrie....."
links.text: ...Roberts, Feuerbach, De Mettrie... suddenly names from your décomptage flash in your forebrain.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "He knew all those people although t..."
links.text: He knew all those people although they're not from his station. They must be big.

links.title: Authority: "And you? Is it an honour to work wi..."
links.text: And you? Is it an honour to work with you? Don't ask him, ask yourself.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "The number shows that this badge be..."
links.text: The number shows that this badge belongs to an officer of the 41st precinct.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "The badge in your hands shines as y..."
links.text: The badge in your hands shines as you rotate it, catching light. You see lines of information on it. And a shining watermark.

links.title: You: "Put the badge away. [Leave.]"
links.text: Put the badge away. [Leave.]

links.title: You: ""I found my badge!""
links.text: "I found my badge!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""At least *something* good came out..."
links.text: "At least *something* good came out of all this." The lieutenant glances at the badge in your hands.

links.title: You: "Study the badge."
links.text: Study the badge.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "Encased between two durable plastic..."
links.text: Encased between two durable plastic sheets is a bluish card with lines of information -- and a watermark in the shape of the street grid of Revachol West.

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "You see: a photo, a name, a rank, a..."
links.text: You see: a photo, a name, a rank, a document number, the date of issue, and -- in the lower right corner -- your precinct.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

links.title: BADGE: LTN-2JFR DU BOIS: "The man in the photo looks at you s..."
links.text: The man in the photo looks at you solemnly.
